result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA: Alexis McKinely DF ATTY: Lida Marie Bannink DF:  Bryce Jared Brown appeared. Case called at 10:34. ADA McKinley updates the court DE is in treatment. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1  in 14CF435. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF435 but withholds the judgment of conviction.  Atty. Bannink suggest change to #8 in the Deferred Agreement. ADA McKinley agrees. DE has completed a compass. ADA McKinley makes statement. Crt orders:  Deferred JOC for 3 years. At the completion of the 3 years there will be a dismissal. If the agreement is sucessful $114. 50 is due 60 days after the 3 years is completed. Review to be set for the Court 2 years 11 months from today.
filed by Attorney Lida Bannink requesting a plea and sentencing date 30 -45 days out. SRN reviewed.
